About

I am a PhD student at the University of Chicago in the department of Human Genetics. My research interests lie primarily in the fields of statistical and population genetics. Prior to the University of Chicago, I recieved my BSc from Cornell University in Computer Science, working with Dr. Alon Keinan and Dr. Amy Williams.

In my free time I enjoy traveling, playing ping-pong, and cooking.

For a more formal (boring) biography, you can find my CV here.
